alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Logan; Madison (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 10:38PM EDT until July 24 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following counties, in Central Ohio, Madison and Union OH. In West Central Ohio, Champaign, Clark and Logan. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1037 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding on several roads in Clark County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Springfield, Marysville, Urbana, Northridge, Plain City, St. Paris, West Liberty, Mechanicsburg, North Lewisburg, Choctaw Lake, New California, Harmony, Brighton, Milford Center, North Hampton, South Vienna, Tremont City, Woodstock, Catawba and Unionville Center.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
